novel.title: Summer Fun
novel.content: An novel in letters about a trans woman who lives in New Mexico and who is a real true fan of a certain band. Forthcoming, Soho Press, 2021.

novel.title: The Dream of Doctor Bantam
novel.content: In mourning after the suicide of her sister, a young woman begins working as a housekeeper for her crush, who belongs to a cult that does not believe in linear time. Lambda Literary Award Finalist. OR Books, 2012.

uncollected.title: The Fountainhead
uncollected.content: The teenage fan of a problematic novelist-philosopher works at an office supply store. Evergreen Review 2.3, March 2019.

uncollected.title: White People Anonymous
uncollected.content: A trans woman is required to join a twelve-step group for white women recovering from online racism. n+1, March 2018.

uncollected.title: Angels Are Here to Help You
uncollected.content: In a mysterious future, one trans woman and her famous cat set out for the stars to start a hallucinogenic drug company. In Meanwhile, Elsewhere, Topside: 2017.

uncollected.title: The L7 Gene
uncollected.content: On returning home for Thanksgiving, a trans woman learns that her mother has created a cis clone of her. WIRED, January 2017.

uncollected.title: Tipping Point
uncollected.content: An actor approaches some trans women with a Proposition. WSQ, Fall/Winter 2016.

uncollected.title: Red Velvet LLC
uncollected.content: Two trans folks attempt to start a bakery company. Twitter Fiction Festival, 2015.

uncollected.title: Vampire Book Tour
uncollected.content: Clearly totally fictional story about vampires. Pushcart nominee. In Where We're Going We Don't Need Roads, Topside: 2014.

blackemerald.title: Myra's Seven Conversations
blackemerald.content: The emotionally unavailable owner of a bed and breakfast offers a conversation service for women who want to fall in love with her. Written 2011.

Comics.title: We're Still Here
Comics.content: The first all-trans comics anthology (as far as we know.) Editor, with Tara Madison Avery. 2018.

Comics.title: Diary Comix
Comics.content: Mostly drawn on the subway to work. 2016-present.

Comics.title: Bad Mother
Comics.content: A young queer woman raises a child to take on the world. 2012-2016.

Comics.title: The Man Who Hates Fun
Comics.content: The heavily crosshatched adventures of a Stoic philosopher and his long-suffering pals. 2004-2012, mostly: I draw new ones.

Comics.title: Diary of a Ghost Girl
Comics.content: A teen falls in love with her own diary. Never completed. 2010-2012.

Games.title: Capitalism 1
Games.content: A short game about what capitalism is like. Construct2, 2014.

Games.title: Capitalism Zero: Crisis in the Stars
Games.content: An ongoing game project about a strange dream. HTML/CSS/JS, 2018-present.

Games.title: Capitalism 2: Planet of the Death Dragons
Games.content: You and your pal will definitely get the better of capitalism this time. Construct2, 2014-present (unfinished).

Design.title: Design project x
Design.content: here is a big block of content!

Editorial.title: editorial project y
Editorial.content: here is a big block of content!

Editorial.title: editorial project z
Editorial.content: here is a big block of content!

About.content: Jeanne Thornton is the author of a bunch of things listed on this site. She is one of the recipients of the [Judith A Markowitz Emerging Writers Award], as well as a [Lambda Literary Fellow] and a three-time [Lambda Literary Award] finalist. She is one of the publishers of Instar Books. She is sometimes available for freelance work, [please inquire].
